title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4235.5 - Eligible and ineligible applicants
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4235.5 - Eligible and ineligible applicants

State Regulations
(a) An eligible applicant for financial
assistance pursuant to section
4235.3
(a)(1)-(2)
of this Part shall mean an eligible business at imminent risk of reducing
employment. (b) The following
enterprises are ineligible for financial assistance pursuant to section
4235.3
(a)(1)-(2)
of this Part: (1)
businesses in existence for
less than three years; (2)
retail
operations; (3)
professional
corporations; (4)
overnight lodging
facilities; (5)
personal service, medical, housing and real estate organizations; and
(6)
businesses which are parties to
litigation pending against the State. (c) To the extent permitted by law, no
full-time employee of the State of New York or any agency, department, authority, or public benefit corporation thereof shall be eligible to receive
assistance under this loan fund, nor shall any eligible businesses or eligible
recipients, the majority ownership interest of which is beneficially controlled
by any such State employee, be eligible for assistance under this loan
fund. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
4235.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
